Authors: Perwiro Atmojo R.N., Lie Y., Muljo H.H., Saputra U.M., Christianto D., Trisaputra D.
Title: The 'Voice of Customer' Web Application at State-Owned Telecommunication Company
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Perwiro Atmojo, R.N., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lie, Y., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Muljo, H.H., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Saputra, U.M., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Christianto, D., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Trisaputra, D., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This research will discuss about the application of web-based Customer Knowledge Management to build an effective communication between customers with a telecommunication company in Indonesia. Customer Knowledge Management (CKM) is more than just a method of applying Knowledge Management (KM) concepts that already exist in an organization. Where, if the KM concept focuses on creating knowledge and innovations sourced from within the organization, the CKM focuses on the consumer's perspective as a trigger for the creation and improvement of innovation. In other words, CKM builds two-way communication between companies and consumers, with the aim of accelerating knowledge creation. Expected knowledge will be more targeted at engaging customer expectations for company services. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: customer knowledge management; customer satisfaction; knowledge management; team-based co-learning; web application
Index Keywords: Customer satisfaction; Human resource management; Knowledge acquisition; Sales; Co-learning; Customer expectation; Customer knowledge management; Effective communication; Knowledge creations; Telecommunication companies; Two way communications; WEB application; Knowledge management
